intro: Gymnaster savatieri, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Markgrafioideae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gymnaster savatieri is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its unique floral structure and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
